thread.title: Morrison hints at tax cuts
thread.title_full: Morrison hints at tax cuts | Business Spectator

author: AAP
title: Morrison hints at tax cuts
text:
Newly-minted Treasurer Scott Morrison has flagged the prospect of future tax cuts, saying he wants to reward people who work hard.
Mr Morrison says the Turnbull government will have a different focus on kick-starting the economy rather than simply "stopping" things like the carbon and mining taxes.
"As a principle of people keeping more of their own money ... yes I believe you can," he told News Corp on Wednesday.
Assistant Innovation Minister Wyatt Roy says it's important Australia is a low-taxing economy to lure entrepreneurs from all over the world.
"We are not going to have the jobs we need if we tax ourselves out of prosperity," he told the Nine Network .
